properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Adelaide 36ers. Tip-off at 8pm, full time around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Local roads around the stadium may close to help crowds move safely around the area.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists are advised to allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Cairns Taipans. Tip-off at 7:30pm, full time around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to the game in the busy Thursday evening peak.

Local roads around the stadium may close to help crowds move safely around the area.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists are advised to allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.Cairns Taipans

Sydney Symphony Under the Stars at Parramatta Park from 8pm to 9:30pm

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as attenddees travel to the event at the same time A-League fans travel to neighbouring CommBank Stadium.

Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Perth Glory at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 7:45pm, full time around 9:45pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game at the same time an event takes place in neighbouring Parramatta Park. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Australia Day at Parramatta Park from 6am to 12pm midday

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as crowds travel to an from the park for Australia Day events.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Central Coast Mariners A-League double header at Industree Group Stadium. Men v Melbourne City from 5pm. Women v Western Sydney Wanderers at 7:45pm, full time around 9:35pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close at 3pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

NBL: Sydney Kings v Perth Wilcats. Tip-off at 2pm, full time around 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park including on the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road as basketball fans travel to and from the game. 

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Newcastle Jets at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 7:45pm, finish around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd (car park open from 4:45pm).
  • EP2 Kippax car park will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice: The festival will be held at Rotary Park from Wednesday 17 to Sunday 28 January and will include stalls and shows over the course of the event. With an increase in pedestrians, motorists are advised to take note of traffic and event signage.
Australia Day celebrations including food stalls, entertainment and fireworks will be held at Gosford Leagues Club Car Park from 4pm to 9pm.
properties.diversions:
The Brian McGowan Bridge (Central Coast Hwy) will have a 40kph speed reduction for motorists and the footpath will be closed to pedestrians from 8.30pm to 9.30pm.


In addition, local road closures will be in place:

•          Georgiana Terrace, between Dane Drive and Baker Street from 11am to the end of the event.

•          Baker Street, between Georgiana Terrace and Vaughan Avenue, from 6am for the duration of the event.

•          Vaughan Avenue will be closed to traffic from 6am to close of event.

•          Alfred Higgs Place, Graham Park will have no stopping signs and barrier boards in place from 6am to close of event.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Brisbane Roar at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off at 7:45pm, full time around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close at 5:45pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Wellington Phoenix at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off from 6pm, finish around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

HTID dance music event at Sydney Showground in Sydney Olympic Park. Start at 3pm, finish at 11pm.

With a sold out crowd of 12,000 expected, traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park. Allow extra travel time on roads including on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Dr and Concord Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Perth Glory at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 5pm, full time approx 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park including on the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road as basketball fans travel to and from the game. 

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Local roads around the stadium may close to help crowds move safely around the area.

properties.otherAdvice:
Carrington Stakes Race Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 12:25pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads and high volumes of taxi and rideshare pick ups and drop offs.

properties.otherAdvice:
Rosehill Gardens Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12:25pm, last race from 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

The Peter Wilson Memorial Touch Gala day will be taking place at Tomaree Sports Complex on Saturday 3 and Sunday 4 February from 6am until 7pm each day. Nelson Bay Road approaching the event site will be busier than usual as attendees and spectators travel to and from the event. The right hand turn lane from Nelson Bay Rd into the venue will be restricted during the event. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.
properties.displayName: Peter Wilson Memorial Touch Football Gala Day

properties.otherAdvice:
Big Bash League: Sydney Thunder v Melbourne Renegades at Sydney Showground in Sydney Olympic Park. Start of play 7:15pm, finish around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as cricket fans travel to the match in the busy evening peak. Allow extra travel time on roads including on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Dr and Concord Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

properties.publicTransport: Ferries will be affected during the day and night due to exclusion zones on the harbour. Buses will also be diverting and using different stops due to road closures. Light rail will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall from 7.30pm to 10.30pm. Visit transportnsw.info for details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, and in Milsons Point will close during the day and evening for Australia Day events in the city and around the harbour.

Key road closure timings:

  • 4am to midnight: George St from Essex St to Lower Fort St, Hickson Rd from George St to Pottinger St and sections of OPT Elevated Rd from Hickson Rd, Circular Quay West and Essex St.
  • 7am to 10am: Hickson Rd from Napoleon St to Pottinger St, Towns Pl from Dalgety Rd to Hickson Rd, Watermans Quay and Barton St (for Oz Day 10K wheelchair race).
  • 7.30pm to 10.30pm: Cahill Expressway lanes 7 & 8 and Overpass at Circular Quay including the High St, Mount St and Domain Tunnel on-ramps and lane 4 on the Harbour Bridge. Roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of Albert St, Alfred St, Circular Quay East, Dalley St, Essex St, George St, Loftus St, Pitt St, Philip St, Macquarie St, Reiby Place, Underwood St and Young St. 
  • The speed limit on the Harbour Bridge will be reduced to 40km/h from 8pm to 9.30pm.
  • The Cahill Expressway Circular Quay overpass walkway will be closed from 5pm to 9:30pm. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Walkway and Cycleway will remain open.
  • Milsons Point/Kirribilli 10:30am to 1pm: Olympic Drive between Broughton St and Alfred St.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks from 3am until midnight and throughout the CBD from 5pm until 10.30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Routes 166, 167 and 177 buses will divert or end trips early while roads are closed along the course. Visit transportnsw.info for more info and to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected at the annual Sun Run event in the Northern Beaches. The 7km run starts at 6:30am and the 10km run starts at 7am, both from The Strand in Dee Why. All events will finish at Manly Beach by 10am.

Road closures, parking restrictions and changed traffic conditions will be in effect starting at 3:30am. All roads will reopen by 11am. 

Residents along the course are urged to plan ahead and relocate their vehicles outside the road closure footprint if vehicle access is required on event day. There will be limited vehicle movements permitted while the event is underway. 

ROAD CLOSURES

  • Dee Why – from 3:30am to 9am: sections of Howard Ave, The Strand and Dee Why Pde, The Oaks Ave westbound crossover will be maintained at The Strand until 6am.
  • Dee Why – from 5:15am to 9am: sections of Oaks Ave, The Stand, Boronia St, Griffin Rd and Monash Pde will be closed.
  • Dee Why – from 6am to 9am: sections of Pacific Pde will be closed.
  • North Curl Curl to Freshwater – from 5:30am to 9am: sections of Abbot Rd, Griffin Rd, Pitt Rd, Adams St, Carrington Pde, Charles St, Evans St and surrounding local roads will be closed. Crossover points will be maintianed on Pacific Pde at Griffin Rd, Playfair Rd at Pitt Rd, Ross St at Pitt Rd and Headland Rd at Griffin Rd until 6:15am.
  • North Curl Curl – from 6am to 9am: Headland Rd will be closed eastbound between Wheeler Pde and Griffin Rd.
  • Freshwater to Queenscliff – from 5:30am to 10am: sections of Lumsdaine Dr, Undercliff Rd, Dalley St, Dowling St, Greycliffe St, Queenscliff Rd and surrounding local roads will be closed. Managed westbound exit on Crown Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St from 5:30am to 6:30am and from 9:15am to 10am.
  • Manly – from 5:30am to 10am: sections of Bridge Rd, Cameron Ave and Collingwood St will be closed.
  • Manly – from 3:30am to 9:30am: sections of North Steyne, Raglan St, Collingwood St and other local roads will be closed.
  • Manly – from 3:30am to 11am: sections of South Steyne, Wentworth St, Ashburner St and Victoria Pde will be closed.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3am until 9am on roads along the course through Dee Why, North Curl Curl, Freshwater, Queenscliff and Manly, including on sections of Abbott Rd, Howard Ave, The Strand, Evans St, Crown Rd North Steyne and South Steyne.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:

CYCLEWAY CLOSURES

Cycleway closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise.

DEE WHY // FROM 3:30AM TO 9AM

  • The Strand between Oaks Ave and Dee Why Pde
arrangementElements.title: Road and cycleway closures

arrangementElements.html:
Vehicle cross over points have been established to facilitate resident access where possible. To ensure the safety of participants, these points will be closed to vehicles while runners pass through.

CROSSOVER POINT CLOSURE TIMES // Managed by Police & traffic controllers

DEE WHY

  • 5:15AM TO 7:20AM – Oaks Ave at The Strand (eastbound)
  • 6AM TO 7:20AM – Oaks Ave at The Strand (westbound)
  • 6:15AM TO 7:45AM – Pacific Pde at Griffin Rd (both directions)

NORTH CURL CURL

  • 6:15AM TO 7:45AM – Headland Rd at Griffin Rd (both directions)
  • 6:15AM TO 8:15AM – Playfair Rd at Pitt Rd (both directions)
  • 6:15AM TO 8:15AM – Ross St at Pitt Rd (both directions)

CURL CURL

  • 6:15AM TO 9AM – Adams St at Carrington Pde (westbound)
  • NOTE: Managed westbound exit from 5:30am until 6:15am

QUEENSCLIFF

  • 6:30AM TO 9:15AM: Crown Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St (both directions)
  • NOTE: Managed westbound exit from Crown Rd from 5:30am until 6:30am, and from 9:15am until 10am

NO ACCESS LOCATIONS

  • DEE WHY & NORTH CURL CURL – residents between the course and the coastline will have no access while crossover points are closed.
  • CURL CURL & FRESHWATER – residents of cul-de sac roads off the western side of the course will have no access until roads reopen.
  • QUEENSCLIFF – residents between the course and the coastline have no access while crossover points are closed.
arrangementElements.title: Vehicle Access + Crossover Points

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways affect both sides unless stated otherwise.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, use the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

DEE WHY // FROM 3AM TO 9AM

  • Howard Ave between The Strand and Clyde Rd
  • The Strand between Dee Why Pde and Oaks Ave (western side)

NORTH CURL CURL // FROM 3AM TO 9AM

  • Abbott Rd between Pitt Rd and Harbord Rd

FRESHWATER // FROM 3AM TO 9AM

  • Evans St* between Charles St and Evans St (southern side)
  • Evans St^ between Evans St and Charles St (northern side)

*NOTE: Clearway in operation between Charles St and no. 9 Evans St (southern side).

^NOTE: Clearway in operation between Evans Reserve and Charles St (northern side).


QUEENSCLIFF// FROM 3AM TO 9AM

  • Crown Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St

MANLY // FROM 3AM TO 9AM

  • North Steyne between Collingwood St and The Corso (eastern side)
  • North Steyne between The Corso and Raglan St (western side)
  • South Steyne between The Corso and Ashburner St (eastern side)
  • South Steyne between Victoria Pde and The Corso (western side)
